meanings.definition: One who speaks or expresses opinions.
meanings.sent1: The voicer in the meeting shared their thoughts on the project.
meanings.sent2: The voicer in the group discussion had a lot to say.
meanings.sent3: The voicer at the party had everyone laughing with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her voicer in the debate was strong and persuasive.
meanings.sent5: The voicer in the classroom always had interesting ideas to share.

meanings.definition: A person who provides the voice for a character in a film or television show.
meanings.sent1: The talented voicer brought the animated character to life with their voice.
meanings.sent2: The voicer for the cartoon character had a unique and recognizable voice.
meanings.sent3: The voicer for the villain in the movie had a sinister laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voicer for the animated princess was sweet and melodic.
meanings.sent5: The voicer for the main character had to convey a range of emotions through their voice.

meanings.sent1: She voicers her concerns about the new policy during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The singer voicers her emotions through her powerful songs.
meanings.sent3: He voicers his excitement for the upcoming concert by practicing every day.
meanings.sent4: The poet voicers the beauty of nature in his verses.
meanings.sent5: They voicer their support for the cause by attending the rally.
